title: Echoes by the Statue
setting_narration: The evening wind sighs softly around the towering Statue of the Seven, carrying the scent of Cecilia flowers. Moonlight bathes the plaza in a gentle glow, highlighting the stoic figure of the Anemo Archon. Below, Diluc stands with his arms crossed, a familiar frown etched on his face, while Kaeya leans against the statue's base, a playful glint in his eye.

segments.text: The air between the two brothers is thick with unspoken history, a common occurrence whenever they find themselves in the same vicinity.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: A beautiful night for introspection, wouldn't you agree, Master Diluc? Or perhaps, contemplation of... warmer memories?

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Cut the theatrics, Kaeya. If you have something to say, say it. My time is not for idle chatter.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: Oh, but this isn't idle chatter. Merely an observation. This spot, under the watchful gaze of the Archon... it makes one think of vows, doesn't it? Or perhaps, promises made under a different moon, to a different heart.

segments.text: Diluc's gaze shifts to the vast expanse of Mondstadt below, his expression hardening slightly at the veiled reference.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Some memories are best left undisturbed. Especially those belonging to the past.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: Ah, but isn't that where all our 'past lovers' reside? Fading echoes, yet sometimes, they feel as vivid as the wind itself. Even for a man as... solitary as yourself.

segments.text: A flicker of something unreadable crosses Diluc's eyes – perhaps regret, perhaps defiance – before it's swiftly masked.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: My past is my own, Kaeya. And unlike some, I don't dwell on what cannot be changed. Good night.

segments.text: Diluc strides away, his cape billowing gently in the breeze. Kaeya watches him go, a faint, melancholic smile playing on his lips as he looks up at the silent Anemo Archon, the city lights twinkling in the distance like forgotten stars.
